commit_message:
Locate RP-tree parent by hypervisor name

Previously we assumed that we can look up the resource provider (created
by nova) to be used as the parent of the agent and physical NIC resource
provider tree by the name set in the config option DEFAULT.host. This
assumption was wrong.

While nova-compute's DEFAULT.host and neutron-agent's DEFAULT.host
must match for port binding to work, the root resource provider created
by nova does not belong to the compute host (where nova-compute runs)
but it belongs to the compute nodes (i.e. hypervisors). Actually there
may be multiple compute nodes managed by a single nova-compute (think
of ironic). Plus the value of DEFAULT.host and the compute node's ID
may be different even when nova-compute manages a hypervisor on the
same host because of various deployment considerations. For example
when tripleo does not manage the undercloud (so a libvirt hypervisor
returns the plain hostname), but the same tripleo enforces it's host
naming conventions in nova's and neutron's DEFAULT.host settings.

This change enables neutron to use the hypervisor name to locate the
root of the resource provider tree.

We introduce a new configuration option for

(1) ovs-agent: resource_provider_hypervisors, for example:

[ovs]
bridge_mappings = physnet0:br-physnet0,...
resource_provider_bandwidths = br-physnet0:10000000:10000000,...
resource_provider_hypervisors = br-physnet0:hypervisor0,...

(2) sriov-agent: resource_provider_hypervisors, for example:

[sriov_nic]
bridge_mappings = physnet1:ens5,...
resource_provider_bandwidths = ens5:10000000:10000000,...
resource_provider_hypervisors = ens5:hypervisor1,...

For both agents 'resource_provider_hypervisors' values default to
socket.gethostname() for each key in resource_provider_bandwidths.

We try to not block later developments in which one neutron
agent may manage devices on multiple hosts. That's why we allow
the each physdev to be associated with a different hypervisor.

But here we do not try to solve the problem that the natural physdev
identifiers may not be unique accross multiple hosts. We leave solving
this problem to whoever wants to implement an agent handling devices of
multiple hosts.

(3) We extend report_state message's configurations field alike:

{
'bridge_mappings': {'physnet0': 'br-physnet0'},
'resource_provider_bandwidths': {
    'br-physnet0': {'egress': 10000000, 'ingress': 10000000}},
'resource_provider_hypervisors': {'br-physnet0': 'hypervisor0'},
...
}

(4) In neutron-server we use
report_state.configurations.resource_provider_hypervisors.PHYSDEV
when selecting parent resource provider for agent and physdev
RP-tree. When not available in the message we fall back to using
report_state.host as before.

Since we only changed the free-format configurations field of the
report_state message rpc version is not bumped and we expect this
change to be backported to stein and train.

Change-Id: I9b08a3a9c20b702b745b41d4885fb5120fd665ce
Closes-Bug: #1853840

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-16 12:53:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix configuration options

When fixing bug #1854188 (Change-ID:
I62e992804a3ae6aa0b4aa4f883807783197d4b33) we broke configuration
options, because now we cannot pass configuration options from the
DEFAULT section, and some ListOpt don't work because cinderlib was
incorrectly expecting all these options to have bounds=True, but some
don't define it and default to False.

This patch fixes this by supporting configuration options from the
DEFAULT section and supporting bounds=True and bounds=False for list and
dict options.

Closes-Bug: #1856556
Change-Id: I67fbf8e9d7ee79f3d6617b4d0ae755dae0e1987a
"}, {'created': '2019-12-18 18:03:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix configuration options

When fixing bug #1854188 (Change-ID:
I62e992804a3ae6aa0b4aa4f883807783197d4b33) we broke configuration
options, because now we cannot pass configuration options from the
DEFAULT section, and some ListOpt don't work because cinderlib was
incorrectly expecting all these options to have bounds=True, but some
don't define it and default to False.

Most of the "crazy" code we currently have around oslo config is because
we wanted to support drivers that add configuration options on runtime
and reload the configuration.

This made sense when cinderlib was not an OpenStack official project,
but now that it is it makes more sense to force Cinder drivers to do the
right thing.

Aligned with this, this patch removes all the faking of the cinder.conf
file as a StringIO object, and simply sets things in the configuration
object that is passed to the drivers, which is the only thing they
should be using.

This will make cinderlib code more robust, even if some drivers will now
need to be modified to work with cinderlib.

The NetApp driver was one of the drivers that would get broken, but
since I have access to it and we can make a very small and targeted
workaround to avoid breaking it, we do it as well.

Closes-Bug: #1856556
Change-Id: I67fbf8e9d7ee79f3d6617b4d0ae755dae0e1987a

We are validating known configuration options and ignoring unknown ones,
like Cinder does.

Closes-Bug: #1856556

commit_message:
Fix configuration options

When fixing bug #1854188 (Change-ID:
I62e992804a3ae6aa0b4aa4f883807783197d4b33) we broke configuration
options, because now we cannot pass configuration options from the
DEFAULT section, and some ListOpt don't work because cinderlib was
incorrectly expecting all these options to have bounds=True, but some
don't define it and default to False.

Most of the "crazy" code we currently have around oslo config is because
we wanted to support drivers that add configuration options on runtime
and reload the configuration.

This made sense when cinderlib was not an OpenStack official project,
but now that it is it makes more sense to force Cinder drivers to do the
right thing.

Aligned with this, this patch removes all the faking of the cinder.conf
file as a StringIO object, and simply sets things in the configuration
object that is passed to the drivers, which is the only thing they
should be using.

This will make cinderlib code more robust, even if some drivers will now
need to be modified to work with cinderlib.

We are validating known configuration options and ignoring unknown ones,
like Cinder does.

The NetApp driver was one of the drivers that would get broken, but
since I have access to it and we can make a very small and targeted
workaround to avoid breaking it, we do it as well.

Closes-Bug: #1856556
Change-Id: I67fbf8e9d7ee79f3d6617b4d0ae755dae0e1987a

subject: Document how to use NodeDataLookup generation utility

commit_message:
Document how to use NodeDataLookup generation utility

The updated version of the Ceph documentation warns
about the problems of using name-based methods of
refering to block devices and suggests use of the
by_path method to avoid this problem. It then links
to the updated Node Specific Hieradata document which
contains a description of how to use the utility from
the related bug.

Change-Id: I2131d87c51f142166f341d2a9c209162659fca43

[{'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2019-12-05 03:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-12-05 05:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/697407/1 : FAILURE in 1h 44m 01s'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-12-05 09:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-12-05 19:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2019-12-05 23:57:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (2 comments)

You're right about first point - I'll separate out the reviews. As to the second, do you think there is any way we can skip processing a heartbeat at all if the timestamp  difference is > agent_down_time? The agent would remain down. It might save a lot of work and DB transactions being done, freeing up RPC workers."}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2019-12-06 00:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2019-12-06 00:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-12-06 02:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/697407/3 : SUCCESS in 1h 54m 47s'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2019-12-06 02:13:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

Hi Jens, I did some further testing and it seems we don't need external=True at all. The Deadlock seems to be intra-process. I was reading and there seem to be issues around eventlet yields and DB/SQL issues. See:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.db/+bug/1350149
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1294942

Perhaps something like that is going on.

I was able to NOT hit the issue despite removing external=True. And the issue is 100% reproducible, so I am confident the fix worked.

If you see my comment #5 on the bug, I pasted some SQL dumps that show the blocking and waiting TRX IDs, mysql threads ids, stuck queries, and connections. I can try to verify that these are indeed coming from the same PID.

tl;dr - I think we are good for cross-host issues, even inter-process. Fix works even when synchronized within a process. This may not be the perfect fix, but it fixes a much more critical and easy to hit issue (sever the DB connection, wait a couple of minutes, then resume - guaranteed to hit it). I think we need it until enginefacade blueprint is completed or my other review goes thru."}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2019-12-06 07:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-12-06 09:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/697407/4 : SUCCESS in 1h 47m 06s'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-12-06 10:17:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

For bugs like this not being able to reproduce the deadlock (here for example for the multi-host case) is usually not a sure way to prove that bug is actually not present because the timings of the reproduction attempt can be easily off unless you make the operation causing the deadlock intentionally *really* slow by adding well-placed sleep()s to the code.

On the other hand dropping out-of-date report_state messages sounds like a good idea. It's a waste to process them if they are older than the agent alive timeout. But we cannot rely on having time sync between agents and controllers. However AMQP brokers give us tools to set message/queue TTLs. For example rabbitmq has this:

https://www.rabbitmq.com/ttl.html

Which seems to be exposed by oslo.messaging:

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/37fabdd895f03d51509aa16e6ae4b344fb909287/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py#L151

This approach would also help on master, not just on stable branches."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-12-06 10:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Which seems to be exposed by oslo.messaging:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/37fabdd895f03d51509aa16e6ae4b344fb909287/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py#L151

Thinking a bit more about this: using that oslo.messaging config option may have unintended consequences since it would time out all fanout and reply queues. Doing this selectively for the q-reports-plugin queues sounds to be safer.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2019-12-19 15:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Please see my comments + I agree with Bence'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-12-19 16:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-05 03:20:52.000000000', 'message': "Lockutils for Agent state report and discard stale messages

This is a temporary fix for https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1853071

The issue is also resolved by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697405/
but hits a few failures in master, but most definitely won't merge
with Queens/Rocky as there many more test failures and dependencies
from enginefacade blueprint which have not been backported into
queens, rocky, and some even stein.

I would suggest this is a must have fix for Queens, Rocky, Stein.
It can be a placeholder in train/master then reverted once the
DB objects make proper change to new_facade.

The first change is critical, and adds a semaphore from Oslo's lockutils.
I have set external=True because we can have multiple RPC workers
and state report workers. With just this change, the easily
reproducible q-reports-plugin growth/stuck DB queries go away.

The other change is just an optimization. If the server loses
connection to AMQP or DB, it won't process report_state RPCs.
q-reports-plugin  builds up. When it recovers, there can be
thousands of stale messages in the queue. I don't see a point
updating stale entries in the DB that will keep agents down, aside from
debugging purposes, but we log it anyways.

Change-Id: Iae0a6f553820322e356ae21b901ab3d796dd1add
Closes-Bug: #1853071

commit_message:
Lockutils for Agent state report

This is a temporary fix for https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1853071

The issue is also resolved by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697215/
but hits a few failures in master, but most definitely won't merge
with Queens/Rocky as there many more test failures and dependencies
from enginefacade blueprint which have not been backported into
queens, rocky, and some even stein.

I would suggest this is a must have fix for Queens, Rocky, Stein.
It can be a placeholder in train/master then reverted once the
DB objects make proper change to new_facade.

This change adds a semaphore from Oslo's lockutils.
Please see my comment #5 on bug for exact blocked queries and transactions.
I suspect it may deal with issues with eventlet yields.
With just this change, the easily reproducible
q-reports-plugin growth/stuck DB queries go away.

Change-Id: Iae0a6f553820322e356ae21b901ab3d796dd1add
Closes-Bug: #1853071

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20.0

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

The change also fixed Apache Kafka URLs in API and persister
configuration in DevStack plugin.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/689513
Change-Id: I9f3c611029385eb9d4ff2a2ff190b441b1971f33
(cherry picked from commit 5e7f9f193d8eb264554479f816b7aea906fa0aad)

commit_message:
Show service_status_updated in instance API

A new field named ``service_status_updated`` is added to the instance
API response which e.g. could be used to validate if the instance
'HEALTHY' status is stale or not.

Change-Id: Iabcfad81343a71304b843b3a7778486253220d20

(3 comments)

Thanks all for the reviews. I have updated the spec to use a different approach which avoids looping over cells. This reduces the number of skipped tasks and should reduce the number of changes required to existing roles to get them to apply to cells. I can push a prototype under a different patch for clarification.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-11-23 11:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-11-23 16:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I have created a patch chain which shows how the approach described here could be used to deploy RabbitMQ and MariaDB/HAProxy/Keepalived, and the changes required to those roles to make it work:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619754/'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-26 13:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-11-26 15:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-26 16:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-26 16:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Just for completeness, an approach that would allow us to use a giant YAML list of cells, without all the skipped tasks, would be to implement a filter plugin to select only those cells to which a host is mapped, e.g.:

include_role:
  role: rabbitmq
with_items: "{{ cells | select_cells }}"

It could probably be done without a filter plugin with sufficient jinja-foo.

Not saying this is better than the group_vars approach, just enumerating options.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:09:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Mark is right, Ansible inventory can be a file, or a directory. When it's a directory - it merges all the files inside - even allows dynamic scripts that output Ansible inventory files (together with group_vars or host_vars defined in that directory or subdirectories). Nobody should edit /usr/share/kolla-ansible/* files - maybe this approach needs documenting :)"}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Just a small note about group/inventory variables, we add globals.yml as -e during kolla-ansible command, this means variables in this file will have the higher precedence over inventory/groups_vars, being that said, we need to make sure no cell variables are defined in globals if we want to reuse them in other cells than cell0'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the comments. Agreed Eduardo, also the same with passwords.yml. I think in that case we can just abstract away those variables, for example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619755/'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-11-27 11:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-11-27 12:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-12-05 16:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-12-05 16:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-12-11 14:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25314, 'date': '2019-05-13 09:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-05-28 12:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Thanks all for the excellent feedback, I will re-work this tomorrow.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-29 11:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-06-04 12:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-06-04 13:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-06-04 13:14:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I've updated this to try and capture the feedback. It seems that the general consensus is to try and avoid using clustered Galera everywhere so I've removed it here."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-07-03 12:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2019-07-03 12:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-07-03 17:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2019-07-03 19:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

To clarify, +1 the approach, most of my comments are nit picks and don’t change the direction here, the broad strikers are spot on'}, {'account_id': 30356, 'date': '2019-07-04 02:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-05 11:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(14 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2019-07-07 05:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-10 13:00:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Discussed this with Doug a bit today. There are some things we can do that will allow us to put all hosts in a single inventory. To do this we need some way to iterate over all of the cells, mariadb instances and rabbitmq instances. One way to do this that aligns well with our 'services' variable model (e.g. glance_services) is to introduce lists of these things. These would probably be global, and set in globals.yml. For example:

nova_cells:
  - name: cell1
    mariadb_group: cell1-mariadb
    rabbitmq_group: shared-rabbitmq

  - name: cell2
    mariadb_group: cell2-mariadb
    rabbitmq_group: shared-rabbitmq

cell_mariadb_instances:
  - group: cell1-mariadb

  - group: cell2-mariadb

cell_rabbitmq_clusters:
  - group: shared-rabbitmq

This gives us something to loop over when executing each role. We'd still use host/group variables for cell_rabbitmq_container_name/port etc.

I'm not sure whether we need to include the nova cell conductor and cell compute groups in the nova_cells list, it's possible that just falls out through group variables - can be decided later.

We can then use mariadb_group to generate the connection string for the correct DB instance, without the user needing to work it out themselves. Perhaps for preconfigured DB support we'd need to support mariadb_address/port fields as a per-cell alternative to the group though.

We also discussed a slightly higher level of abstraction, where we assign a name to each rabbitmq cluster and mariadb instance, then reference those instead of the group name. This would require a bit of jinja magic internally, but might be clearer for the user.

nova_cells:
  - name: cell1
    mariadb_instance: cell1
    rabbitmq_cluster: shared

  - name: cell2
    mariadb_instance: cell2
    rabbitmq_cluster: shared

cell_mariadb_instances:
  - name: cell1
    group: cell1-mariadb

  - name: cell2
    group: cell2-mariadb

cell_rabbitmq_clusters:
  - name: shared
    group: shared-rabbitmq"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-10 13:01:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Supporting multiple rabbitmq clusters outside of cells could be done by adding a similar list, with a single entry by default of the existing cluster:

rabbitmq_clusters:
  - group: rabbitmq'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-12-19 15:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has served its purpose. Support for deploying multiple cells has been merged in the Train release.'}]

commit_message:
Add a spec for Nova cells

This spec is based on the good work that has already been undertaken
on cells v2 support by the Kolla community. It serves as a strawman
to help define exactly how cells support should be implemented in
Kolla-Ansible.

Change-Id: I7b96f2b42a3e9e60ee0e2d516c731b7727948980

commit_message:
Enable image import plugins & image output format

Adding GlanceImageImportPlugins & GlanceImageConversionOutputFormat
to enable glance image conversion.

Since, glance-image-import.conf has been newly added while adding
plugin framework in glance, passing the conf file to puppet_tags
in docker service.

Depends-on: I098aa0cabf2518b8861d5b58b885d9bdef54a7f6
Change-Id: I81b788e38eecb3e0be88b140df3ae1ebb70cb191
Closes-Bug: #1807366
(cherry picked from commit 9333740b69f47f4bb1d5117398ddca715e1017ca)

commit_message:
Retire remaining fuel repos (step 2)

Add noop-jobs for x/fuel repos including x/network-checker where
needed so that they can get retired.

Announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011675.html

Change-Id: Ic1ce7c1d357ce2c121035d0feafd0fe965a63e6c

commit_message:
Install Ansible with pip

Fixes any problems with pip not being able to remove system packages
(`python-yaml` for example) to install a newer version from pip.

Change-Id: I846b43da43134ea92a2a3435585829ccf0416e54
Story: 2004568
Task: 28333

commit_message:
Make it possible to use uwsgi easily

This patch adds a standard /usr/bin/magnum-api-uwsgi script, which we can
use from uwsgi. Without this patch, there's no way to load the application
correctly, with parameters on the command line.

Change-Id: Icdcd1255e7e08d68a5d31672b21127f781d6ac68

commit_message:
Add support to get disk_formats from glance

This patch allows administrators to set disk_formats only for glance,
while horizon will retrieve list of supported formats from glance API.
IMAGE_BACKEND_SETTINGS still may be used to redefine display name
of the format or additionally limit list of availble ones.

Change-Id: Ia4ea513023895f4ad2a87f91e3d2837c7668d9ae
Closes-Bug: 1853822

[{'created': '2019-12-12 21:01:07.000000000', 'message': "Make ()'s around step|int optional

When computing the per step tasks, the step|int expression is sometimes
enclosed in parens. This commit updates the regular expression to
account for those.

commit_message:
Make ()'s around step|int optional

When computing the per step tasks, the step|int expression is sometimes
enclosed in parens. This commit updates the regular expression to
account for those.

commit_message:
Make nova_novncproxy use BUMPs

We have a lock of VNC version inside repo_packages [1]. We should
try using it as otherwise this may result in broken console

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/stable/stein/playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/nova_consoles.yml#L33

Change-Id: Icd1fe43c9fa3ab16f9bdaf0a2cb60854c0e15e97
(cherry picked from commit 1de7b24e701bda75e0fc1d019510f71f16608502)

commit_message:
Add neutron-fwaas-dashboard integration tests

This patch adds basic tests to verify that neutron-fwaas-dashboard
is installed and could be opened.

Also this patch decoupless sphinx vesrions for Python 2.7 and 3.x
to fix gates.

neutron-fwaas-dashboard job is added in a non-voting mode.

Change-Id: I1dca0bfbdc44186fffcbe757a142c930f5bc14b4

Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and tackerclient use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/python-tackerclient/search?q=jsonutils&unscoped_q=jsonutils

Change-Id: I41fa78a7fb5fabd0839caa29545efae1e0b4329c

oslo project provide jsonutils, and the others use it
in many place, this PS to update the json module to
oslo jsonutils for consistency.

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

in many place[1], this PS to update the remained json moudule to
oslo jsonutils for consistency.

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

2. Clean "python setup.py build_sphinx" up and use "sphinx-build"
consistently[2]

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: I11fa7a1de736dd615878572942bcfd9e7fb45211

[{'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-12-13 15:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-13 17:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Seems OK. Just need to wait until Monday for stable review.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-13 22:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-12-19 10:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"Add radvd_user config option" goes a bit against stable policy, but that ship seems to have sailed ?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-19 12:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> "Add radvd_user config option" goes a bit against stable policy,
 > but that ship seems to have sailed ?

That one caught my attention too, so I had looked closer. It's a config option added to address a real bug, and the default for the config option appears to make it so not setting it keeps the behavior consistent to what it was before. There is also a good release note included that alerts to the new config option and why it is needed. So it looks like it was done in a way that is consistent with our stable policies.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-12-19 14:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Sail away'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-12-19 14:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nicely summed up by Sean, just to confirm nothing changes if the new configuration option is not set (and default value has same behaviour)'}]

commit_message:
Cap hacking version to <2

Hacking 2.0.0 and its dependencies like flake8 have incompatible changes
and bumping to them leads to pep8 check failure.
It is good to address pep8 warnings in the master branch, but in case of
stable branches it is good to continue to use the same version of hacking.
This commit is proposed to the master branch so that it can be backported.

Change-Id: I2b174ef3231956037650eba19aebe5989dffa617
(cherry picked from commit 7a7558b0583fa84f73d5ecb81204cbb76b0ef0e5)

commit_message:
Cap hacking version to <2

Hacking 2.0.0 and its dependencies like flake8 have incompatible changes
and bumping to them leads to pep8 check failure.
It is good to address pep8 warnings in the master branch, but in case of
stable branches it is good to continue to use the same version of hacking.
This commit is proposed to the master branch so that it can be backported.

Change-Id: I2b174ef3231956037650eba19aebe5989dffa617
(cherry picked from commit 7a7558b0583fa84f73d5ecb81204cbb76b0ef0e5)

messages: [{'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-12-03 15:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2019-12-19 11:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-03 15:53:58.000000000', 'message': "Make kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized voting

We don't have any voting containerized gate, yet the preferred way to
run Kuryr-Kubernetes is in containers running on top of K8s cluster it
is serving.

This makes very little sense and this commit makes the most basic
containerized gate voting.

Change-Id: Ia77d52466635974cc826e31da77c14184c36d601
"}]
commit_message:
Make kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized voting

We don't have any voting containerized gate, yet the preferred way to
run Kuryr-Kubernetes is in containers running on top of K8s cluster it
is serving.

This makes very little sense and this commit makes the most basic
containerized gate voting.

Change-Id: Ia77d52466635974cc826e31da77c14184c36d601

commit_message:
Fix: add a default value for cinderlib_pool_name

Otherwise CL_FTEST_POOL_NAME is not defined by default
when using run-cinderlib-tests, thus leading to an error.

Change-Id: I47f7ea6f877e299c55f5517a72beadac7ccf78b0

commit_message:
Fix single unit upgrade-charm

On a single unit rabbitmq on upgrade-charm peer_retrieve would throw a
ValueError because there is no peer "cluster" relation.

Handle this edege case.

Closes-Bug: #1842970

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in
place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Note that python35-charm-jobs is retained since this charm is supported
on Xenial.

Change-Id: I10bcd0c4847e2f0828c8df6d23d148d2b55c74f7
Story: #2005924
Task: #34228

commit_message:
Reflect abandon status in generated docs

This updates our sphinx extension and deliverable parsing to denote
deliverables that are no longer active by showing abandoned deliverables
as EOL.

Change-Id: I332f3681bae55d06751d6666174816106a58be48
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove telemetry checks

The telemetry tests are not actively maintained and have been failing
checks for quite some time. Remove the non-voting tests for now and
plan to introduce new tests in the future for better coverage of
notifications.

Change-Id: I6c30c28ee4c8be4677ccecf8822af15b060cf804

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 20:31:48.000000000', 'message': '[k8s] Remove indentation in /etc/sysconfig/heat-params

There is harmless but unnecessary indentation in
/etc/sysconfig/heat-params for the master node only which would be nice
to remove going forward. This issue does not exist in minions.

This oddity was introduced in Ibbed59bc135969174a20e5243ff8464908801a23.

Task: 37812
Story: 2002210

Change-Id: I7ca2893b44ea5cb057e51013dbcb34efb18d54ed
(cherry picked from commit c37ca0f0d2ed65dbb17d0ee8c35133581c38469b)
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s] Remove indentation in /etc/sysconfig/heat-params

There is harmless but unnecessary indentation in
/etc/sysconfig/heat-params for the master node only which would be nice
to remove going forward. This issue does not exist in minions.

This oddity was introduced in Ibbed59bc135969174a20e5243ff8464908801a23.

Task: 37812
Story: 2002210

Change-Id: I7ca2893b44ea5cb057e51013dbcb34efb18d54ed

subject: config: Expose the introduced in Train cpu-dedicated-set's option
messages: [{'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2019-11-18 09:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-12-19 12:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-18 09:43:07.000000000', 'message': "config: Expose the introduced in Train cpu-dedicated-set's option

The per-host config cpu-dedicated-set will provide new flexibility by
adding ability to pack guests vCPUs which need dedicated host CPUs vs
guests vCPUs which can float over a set of host CPUs (see:
cpu-shared-set).

Change-Id: Ia2181ad2bd1894d5c2f91be5df8396bc77555658
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
config: Expose the introduced in Train cpu-dedicated-set's option

The per-host config cpu-dedicated-set will provide new flexibility by
adding ability to pack guests vCPUs which need dedicated host CPUs vs
guests vCPUs which can float over a set of host CPUs (see:
cpu-shared-set).

Change-Id: Ia2181ad2bd1894d5c2f91be5df8396bc77555658
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

So it turns out we install python3-libmaas for stonith and not for dnsha. So this is gating on the wrong configuration. Rather than looking for maas_url we should be checking stonith_enabled.  

Note: we *want* to move dnshha to python3-libmaas but it does not use that yet. It currently uses the very similarly named python3-maas-client. (2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-02-13 15:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-02-14 15:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-02-20 10:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi David, this patch looks fine but I would feel better if I knew it had been deploy tested (beyond the amulet test). Would you be able to deploy Swift in HA with this patch and test that (a) all proxy services remain stopped during ring syncs and (b) come back up in good time and order once the syncs are finished. This is particularly important with an HA deployment since non-HA does not involve any ring/builder syncing.'}, {'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-02-21 09:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sure, i can test some more, i ran it manually on server stack lab environment'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-05-24 08:44:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Has the further testing been completed David? Along with Ed, I'd like to see some HA validation of this change, as it will only affect HA deploys"}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-08-20 20:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Is this change still being pursued?  It has no test coverage, and the reviewers are asking for that.  Please advise.  Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-12-19 12:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No response in 4 months to review feedback as requested - closing review.

Please re-open and address feedback if still required.'}]

commit_message:
Switching out service_stop for service_pause for swift-proxy service

 During ring syncs, we should disable the service to avoid inadvertant
 service start by config-changed hook.

 If start is called the service init file won't be present to be
 executed.  Only when service_resume is called after the ring_sync
 completes will the service file be available again.

 Closes-Bug: #1723427

Change-Id: I4b59ae94d502dafff27d1f38007b68b55a565dae

subject: [fix] Allow cluster OS upgrade without specifying kube_tag
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-17 21:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-18 09:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-12-19 09:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-19 11:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 21:31:05.000000000', 'message': "[fix] Allow cluster OS upgrade without specifying kube_tag

If kube_tag is not specified in the new cluster_template, the existing
kube_tag should be reused. At the moment, we simply see this error which
does not make any sense:

    $ openstack coe cluster upgrade k8s k8s-alt
    '\'kube_tag\'\n (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-652883e9-05f3-43f1-b94d-8c6e0de75a2e)

Story: 2005201
Task: 37712

Change-Id: Ic15ad96a13f18c820bba592d4550f3a4fa951ffb
(cherry picked from commit 895b693c07caae39c20cfd94c2d415a481334e1a)
"}]
commit_message:
[fix] Allow cluster OS upgrade without specifying kube_tag

If kube_tag is not specified in the new cluster_template, the existing
kube_tag should be reused. At the moment, we simply see this error which
does not make any sense:

    $ openstack coe cluster upgrade k8s k8s-alt
    '\'kube_tag\'\n (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-652883e9-05f3-43f1-b94d-8c6e0de75a2e)

Story: 2005201
Task: 37712

Change-Id: Ic15ad96a13f18c820bba592d4550f3a4fa951ffb
(cherry picked from commit 895b693c07caae39c20cfd94c2d415a481334e1a)

Needed for Ie862e88ccb82c819b93fa2dbc5f21af61b138046'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-05-16 08:28:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2019-07-14 14:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-12-19 07:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-12-19 09:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-04 08:52:33.000000000', 'message': "Use resource description as default description property

We allow users to provide a description for a resource that shows up in
the Heat API. Many resource types also allow users to add descriptions,
and these have typically been exposed as properties rather than by
trying to read the resource's own description.

To prevent the need to duplicate information, use the resource's
description as the default for any top-level properties named
'description'.

One downside of this is that any changes to the resource description
could cause updates to the resource. (However, there are no issues
specific to updgrades, because the subsitution is also done on the
previous properties.) To guard against the worst of this, only enable
this behaviour if the description can be updated without resource
replacement.

Change-Id: I56560d014a02b5f2ddbc08689d39147fbe4ffca4
"}]
commit_message:
Use resource description as default description property

We allow users to provide a description for a resource that shows up in
the Heat API. Many resource types also allow users to add descriptions,
and these have typically been exposed as properties rather than by
trying to read the resource's own description.

To prevent the need to duplicate information, use the resource's
description as the default for any top-level properties named
'description'.

One downside of this is that any changes to the resource description
could cause updates to the resource. (However, there are no issues
specific to updgrades, because the subsitution is also done on the
previous properties.) To guard against the worst of this, only enable
this behaviour if the description can be updated without resource
replacement.

Change-Id: I56560d014a02b5f2ddbc08689d39147fbe4ffca4

commit_message:
Cap hacking in test-requirements.txt

hacking as a linter is in global requirements blacklist and so is not in
constraints. Recent release introduced new rules that required fix on
master, on stable branches we should rather cap to the version that was
in use during this release development.

Change-Id: I6492eb089b4977655b5c6977d36e13260f85f7ed
(cherry picked from commit 6d9aae2ab3c138623aa66544614b65ef5b5cd91e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 16:04:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add resolve_CONFIGS to action-managed-upgrade

In change-id I08a847abe7db22a11860f359442e1e8945585466 which
addresses bug #1844325, CONFIGS must be loaded by any function
needing to import and use CONFIGS.  When running openstack-upgrade
via juju actions, CONFIGS = None causing traceback when running
configs.set_release(new_release).  This change provides the
CONFIGS resolution to enable action managed upgrades.

Change-Id: I9258d798f9d6d75822cd5446ee039308a43da867
Closes-Bug: #1851943
'}]
commit_message:
Add resolve_CONFIGS to action-managed-upgrade

In change-id I08a847abe7db22a11860f359442e1e8945585466 which
addresses bug #1844325, CONFIGS must be loaded by any function
needing to import and use CONFIGS.  When running openstack-upgrade
via juju actions, CONFIGS = None causing traceback when running
configs.set_release(new_release).  This change provides the
CONFIGS resolution to enable action managed upgrades.

Change-Id: I9258d798f9d6d75822cd5446ee039308a43da867
Closes-Bug: #1851943

commit_message:
Add new config option to set [spice].agent_enabled

This new config called spice-agent-enabled is added to inform the spice agent
is not installed in the guest instance, which in conjunction with an image
property hw_pointer_model=usbtablet allows accurate position of the mouse in
Windows guests.

This option is not rendered in the nova.conf local to nova-cloud-controller
units, instead it's passed to related nova-compute units.

Change-Id: Id64699b6d04aa05935b31d55532df45c6d973fa7
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699461
Closes-Bug: #1856602

commit_message:
Make taskflow reproducible

This patch forward what has been sent to the Debian bug tracker:
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=860374

Please consider this patch to allow reproducibility. If you don't
know about reproducible builds, please read:
https://wiki.debian.org/ReproducibleBuilds/About

Change-Id: I40e1d660cfc0f1de17a56668336918148fb97609

commit_message:
Cap hacking in test-requirements.txt

hacking as a linter is in global requirements blacklist and so is not in
constraints. Recent release introduced new rules that required fix on
master, on stable branches we should rather cap to the version that was
in use during this release development.

Change-Id: I6492eb089b4977655b5c6977d36e13260f85f7ed

subject: Install chrony on host
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 21314, 'name': 'Cam J. Loader', 'display_name': 'Cam J. Loader', 'email': 'cameron@loaderusa.net', 'username': '4-cameron'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25023, 'name': 'Jonathan Rosser', 'email': 'jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk', 'username': 'jrosser'}, {'_account_id': 28619, 'name': 'Dmitriy Rabotyagov', 'email': 'noonedeadpunk@gmail.com', 'username': 'noonedeadpunk'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-12-18 17:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21314, 'date': '2019-12-18 18:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-12-18 20:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-12-19 10:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>
'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-12-19 10:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Installation of chrony is already described in the steps that the deployer must take to prepare their hosts. See https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/openstack-ansible/train/targethosts.html

There are situations where you specifically *dont* want chrony installed or configured, for example where the host clocks are synchronised using PTP instead of NTP which requires an entirely different approach.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-12-19 11:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, then I think we should edit hardening role to disable chrony task when it's not installed"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-12-19 11:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-12-19 12:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned in favor of https://review.opendev.org/699963'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 17:46:19.000000000', 'message': 'Install chrony on host

This patch updates the vars to install chrony in
order to enable successful completion of the ansible-hardening tasks.

Change-Id: I30e7427e9a7a910a08aa2c957a0c229bb9531187
'}]
commit_message:
Install chrony on host

This patch updates the vars to install chrony in
order to enable successful completion of the ansible-hardening tasks.

Change-Id: I30e7427e9a7a910a08aa2c957a0c229bb9531187

[{'created': '2019-12-16 06:10:14.000000000', 'message': 'Cap hacking version to <2

Hacking 2.0.0 and its dependencies like flake8 have incompatible changes
and bumping to them leads to pep8 check failure.
It is good to address pep8 warnings in the master branch, but in case of
stable branches it is good to continue to use the same version of hacking.
This commit is proposed to the master branch so that it can be backported.

Change-Id: I2b174ef3231956037650eba19aebe5989dffa617
'}]
commit_message:
Cap hacking version to <2

Hacking 2.0.0 and its dependencies like flake8 have incompatible changes
and bumping to them leads to pep8 check failure.
It is good to address pep8 warnings in the master branch, but in case of
stable branches it is good to continue to use the same version of hacking.
This commit is proposed to the master branch so that it can be backported.

Change-Id: I2b174ef3231956037650eba19aebe5989dffa617
